newsitem.title: USA: Nebraska fed cattle up $1 at $107/dressed - trade.
newsitem.headline: Nebraska fed cattle up $1 at $107/dressed - trade.

text.p: Nebraska feedlot cattle near Tuesday sold steady to up $1.00 per cwt at $106.00 to $107.00 on a dressed basis in light volume, market sources and USDA said.
About 1,200 head had sold by midday, USDA said. Slaughter steers and heifers were not well tested on a live basis.
Further bids at $106.00 to $107.00 were countered by a asking levels of $108.00 on a dressed basis. Live bids at $64.00 to $54.00 were met by asking levels of $67.00.
This week's showlist was estimated near 80,000 head, down 15,000 from last week, market sources said.
